questions.question_text: The NAC Agent uses which port and protocol to send discovery packets to an ISE Policy Service Node?

discussion.content:
The SWISS protocol is a stateless request response protocol that allows NAC Agents which are running on managed clients to discover the Cisco ISE server, and retrieve configuration and operational information. The
NAC Agent connects to the Cisco ISE server by sending SWISS unicast discovery packets out on User Datagram Protocol (UDP) port 8905 until a Cisco ISE node that assumes the Policy Service persona sends a response to the client. 
https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/ise/1.0/user_guide/ise10_pos_pol.pdf

comments.content: Agreed that it's 8905 but not sure that it's UDP.

discussion.content:
ISE Administration Guide 2.6:
Create a Native Supplicant Profile to be Used in Client Provisioning Policy
You can create native supplicant profiles to enable users to bring personal devices to your Corporate network.
Cisco ISE uses different policy rules for different operating systems. Each client provisioning policy rule
contains a native supplicant profile, which specifies which provisioning wizard is to be used for which operating
system.
Before you begin
• Configure the CA certificate template in Cisco ISE.
• Open up TCP port 8905 and UDP port 8905 to enable Cisco NAC Agent, Cisco NAC Web Agent, and
supplicant provisioning wizard installation. For more information on port usage, see the "Cisco ISE
Appliance Ports Reference" appendix in the Cisco Identity Services Engine Hardware Installation Guide

questions.question_text: A network engineer is configuring HTTP based CWA on a switch. Which three configuration elements are required? (Choose three.)

choices.F: Radius authentication on the port with 802.1x
choices.B: Radius authentication on the port with MAB

questions.question_text: Which three statements describe differences between TACACS+ and RADIUS? (Choose three.)

choices.B: TACACS+ encrypts the entire packet, while RADIUS encrypts only the password.
choices.D: TACACS+ uses TCP, while RADIUS uses UDP.
choices.E: RADIUS uses ports 1812 and 1813, while TACACS+ uses port 49.
choices.C: RADIUS uses TCP, while TACACS+ uses UDP.
choices.F: TACACS+ uses ports 1812 and 1813, while RADIUS uses port 49
choices.A: RADIUS encrypts the entire packet, while TACACS+ encrypts only the password.

discussion.content: For a triggered SNMP query to occur, either the RADIUS probe or SNMP Trap probe must be enabled and associated components must be configured correctly. To retrieve CDP or LLDP information, the endpoint must support CDP or LLDP and either or both of these protocols must be enabled on the access switch.

questions.question_text: What attribute could be obtained from the SNMP query probe?
